items.title: LEGO’s 16-bit Super Mario World: Mario & Yoshi set with movable legs/tongue falls to new $104 low (Reg. $130)
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the best price to date on the LEGO Super Mario World: Mario & Yoshi set at $104 shipped. Normally, you’d be shelling out $130 for this set directly from LEGO, which famously offers very few discounts; however, at Amazon, it’s been seeing some cascading savings since the end of August, dropping to $119, then $117, and now lower-than-ever to $104. This is a 20% markdown that cuts $26 off the tag price, giving you the all-time lowest price we have tracked since it hit the market back in October.

Simply enter promo code SSEWA63 at checkout to secure the discount. Newegg dishes out these discounted gift cards quite frequently, but this one lines up perfectly for picking up Silksong or even stacking up on Game Pass Ultimate ahead of the big launch. The game, in case you’re wondering, is coming to the Xbox Game Pass tomorrow.

NYC-based Etherealize, which develops products and infrastructure on Ethereum for financial institutions, raised $40M led by Electric Capital and Paradigm  —  The crypto markets are booming, but the most recent wave of enthusiasm isn't just from small-time traders or dabblers curious about memecoins.

Meta launches Instagram for iPadOS, 15 years after its iOS debut; it is slightly different than the mobile app, most notably opening directly to a feed of Reels  —  The long-requested app will feature Reels prominently on the homepage. … After years of requests from users, Instagram will finally have a dedicated app for iPad.
